ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Some additional grammar skills including a lot of future and past tense conjugations of different types of vowels. Also a lot of vocabulary.
I learned much about Hebrew grammar including mastering the past tense and much of the future tense. I also significantly improved my vocabulary, comprehension, and reading abilities.
Best Hebrew class I've taken at Yale. Really helped sharpen my skills, I definitely recommend it for anyone coming from L2 -- 100% worth it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: You learn quite a bit of Hebrew in a short amount of time. Weaknesses: Be prepared for 30 mins - 1hour+ of homework PER NIGHT (especially on asynchronous days). Material is not so interesting, but I guess that it's a language class, so you can't really expect a whole lot. Some projects felt overly involved, while other assignments felt totally useless. Also, some of the work included watching tv series, which could take an hour+ of watching per week.
The strengths were that concepts were explained well and sufficient practice was given. The weakness was that the work could definitely pile on at some points.
Strengths: Direct engagement, clear feedback, professor Goren's availability to discuss

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Well, you probably have taken L1 and L2 if you are going for this class, so Hebrew is kind of your thing at this point. I didn't love the class, but its not so bad if you have to take it for your language requirement.
This course is phenomenal for anyone who genuinely cares about learning better Hebrew. It is a lot of work if just doing for the credit.
Yes, absolutely. Professor Goren is wonderful and makes learning Hebrew an interesting and worthwhile expereince.
